snippet: Over all, the Senate version hews closely to the budgetary intent of the House proposal. But the primary flash point is likely to be over military spending.
abstract: Senate Republicans release budget document that keeps tight limits on military spending and cuts trillions of dollars from health care and welfare; House Republicans are attempting to dodge spending caps by adding nearly $40 billion to military spending through 'emergency' war funding account; chart illustrates sharp contrasts between House and Senate Republican budget proposals and that of Obama administration.
lead_paragraph: Over all, the Senate version hews closely to the budgetary intent of the House proposal. But the primary flash point is likely to be over military spending.

headline.main: Senate Republicans Rebuff House Colleagues With Their Budget Plan
headline.print_headline: Senate Republicans Rebuff House Colleagues With Their Budget Plan
